title: Scrollbars should be disabled in ImageAnalyzer example
description: When using Build F2 (20020602) on Redhat 7.2 with GTK2KDE 2.210 (GTK2 only), when opening the ImageAnalyzer example, the scrollbars are enabled. However, they can be moved around without any effect. When opening a small image, such as an icon, the scrollbars are misleading because they don't do anything.
OB: When opening the ImageAnalyzer example, the scrollbars are enabled and can be moved around without any effect. This issue can be observed with Build F2 (20020602) on Redhat 7.2 with GTK2KDE 2.210 (GTK2 only).
EB: The scrollbars in the ImageAnalyzer example should be disabled to prevent them from being misleading.
SR:
1. Launch Build F2 (20020602) on Redhat 7.2 with GTK2KDE 2.210 (GTK2 only).
2. Open the ImageAnalyzer example.
3. Observe that the scrollbars are enabled and can be moved around without any effect.
4. Open a small image, such as an icon, and observe that the scrollbars are misleading and don't have any functionality.
